intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon, I have come to report on Lord/Lady Corrin's progress. It would seem he/she successfully captured Notre Sagesse for the glory of Nohr. As for the Rainbow Sage, he/she didn't kill him with his/her own hands... However, as ordered, the Sage is dead.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: So the ancient one has finally passed on... Once more, Corrin has dutifully fulfilled my wishes. Heh heh heh... Ha ha ha ha... MWA HA HA HAA HAAAA!!!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: King Garon? Milord?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: HA HA HA HA HA! MWA HA HA HA HAAA!!!

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Your majesty?!

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: ... Iago.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: Y-yes, sire?

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I have an important mission for you. I command you... to make Corrin suffer. Make him/her rue the day he/she was born. But no matter what, no matter how he/she begs for death, do not kill him/her.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: As you wish, sire, but... I'm not entirely sure I understand your aim.

intro.speaker: Garon
intro.line: I do not need you to understand, only to obey. Loyal servant... it is of grave importance that I rule Hoshido. Corrin's life and happiness are a trifling price to pay. Still, he/she must be kept alive for now... the Great Dragon has willed it so. Corrin's body and soul must be tested... primed for what is to come. Like a calf fattened for slaughter, so too shall these trials prepare him/her. My dear son/daughter is not ready, but his/her time is fast approaching. Corrin has faithfully followed my orders thus far, but it's time for a test. He/She must fight those he/she doesn't wish to fight... kill those he/she doesn't wish to kill. His/her sorrow will feed the darkness in his/her soul. And his/her suffering will make him/her a worthy sacrifice upon the altar of Anankos.

intro.speaker: Iago
intro.line: I understand, King Garon. It shall be done, with pleasure. In fact, I have an idea...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank the gods - we're finally back in familiar territory. If we keep up this pace, we'll be back at the castle in just a few days.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: Th-that's good... I'm at the end of my rope. Can't wait to sleep in my own bed.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ha ha, poor Elise. You've been through a lot on this journey, haven't you? I've asked so much of you, and you've never complained once. You're an inspiration. Just hang in there a bit longer for me, OK? We'll be back home before you know it.

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: You got it, Corrin! I promise I won't let you down!

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: *pant... pant...* *cough*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise? Are you OK, little one?

intro.speaker: Elise
intro.line: I don't... feel so well. Why is... everything... spinning... *gasp*

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: ELISE!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Elise, speak to me! What's wrong?! Please, no... Gods, she's burning up!

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Dizziness, fever... Ah, and a rash, too. Just as I feared...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Azura, what is it?! Have you seen these symptoms before?

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: Unless I'm mistaken, she is suffering from an illness endemic to the islands. She must have been exposed to it while we were in Notre Sagesse. The illness progresses quickly. If we don't act fast... we may lose her. There's a special plant in Hoshido that I could derive a cure from, however... I'm sorry, but... I don't believe there's anything like it here in Nohr.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We have to do something, dammit. I won't let her die. I won't!

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Corrin! We just received new orders from Iago.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Now?! Are you kidding me? We don't have time for this. What is it Father requires of me?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: He apparently wishes to reward you for your success in Notre Sagesse. We are to travel to the royal palace in Macarath for rest and relaxation.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Rest? Can it be? Thank goodness. I was afraid he was going to order me to kill again. Perhaps they can help Elise there... it's our only hope.

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: What do you mean? Is there something wrong with the princess?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: She caught a deadly ailment while we were on our last mission. Azura can cure her with a special plant, but it only grows in Hoshido...

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: Don't worry, Corrin. Macarath will surely have what she needs.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Will they, Silas? How do you know?

intro.speaker: Silas
intro.line: The best doctors in all the land can be found in Macarath. Their stock of medicines is unrivaled.

intro.speaker: Azura
intro.line: We must hurry, Corrin. She doesn't have much time...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Let's move it people! To Macarath! Hang in there, Elise...

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: We finally made it to Palace Macarath. There's hope yet. But why is there a crowd at the entrance... Wait... th-that's not just any crowd. It's the Hoshidan army! And they're not alone...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Hello, Corrin. I've been waiting for you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma...

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: It's been a while, brother/sister. I haven't seen you since that fateful day on the border. I see you've become a faithful Nohrian dog since then. Your master must be proud.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I don't wish to argue, Ryoma. How did you know we were coming to Macarath?

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: That doesn't concern you. All you need to know is how fast you can draw your blade.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma, please... Let us pass. I beg of you. My sister, Elise, is gravely ill. If we don't treat her right away, she'll die.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: The Nohrian princess is sick, is she? I can tell she means a lot to you. Well then, I believe a trade is in order. Her life for yours. Come back to Hoshido with me, and I shall withdraw my troops immediately.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: You know I can't do that. Please, have mercy.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Your only other option is to fight me, here and now. Ready your blade, Corrin. Show me what you're made of.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma, stop this! Please! There must be another way. Although I fight for Nohr, I do not wish to be an enemy of Hoshido. I wish for nothing but peace. Please believe me, Brother.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: More empty words. Even if that were true, I doubt that monster you call a father shares the sentiment. They've brainwashed you, brother/sister. You are blind to their evil and cowardly ways. If the sting of my blade is the only way to bring you back to your senses, so be it.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma! Don't do this!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: I won't back down today, brother/sister. You're coming home. Now. Prepare to witness firsthand my blade's true power... As the high prince of Hoshido, I order you to surrender! HYAAAAH!!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Argh!
Not on my watch!
Heh hee! Prepare to DIE!

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Argh!! Wh-what is the meaning of this?!

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: Heh, looks like we made it just in the nick of time. I'm glad to find you unharmed, milord/milady.

intro.speaker: Peri
intro.line: Aw, phooey. I didn't get any stabby-stabby time in. At least we saved you.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thanks for your help, but who are you?

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: You may call me Laslow. My liege, Lord Xander, sent us here to watch your back.

intro.speaker: Peri
intro.line: I'm Peri! P for pulverize, E for eviscerate, R for ruin, I for impale! Kee hee! Laslow and I are Lord Xander's retainers. He's really worried about you! That's why he sent us to kill things on his behalf. Best job ever!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: That sounds like Xander. Thank you for your assistance, friends.

intro.speaker: Ryoma
intro.line: Ah, so you're Prince Xander's retainers. That explains a lot. Your master taught you well if you were able to deflect my attacks like that. But my retainers are just as strong, and their cause is much nobler. You may harbor my brother/sister, but I won't make this easy on you, Nohrians. Troops! Prepare for battle!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Ryoma, wait! Listen to me! Ryoma...

intro.speaker: Peri
intro.line: It's no use. I know that look in his eyes... it's the same one I have! It means he's raring to fight.

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: Please don't look so glum, milord/milady. It's bad for morale. It's always best to smile during times of hardship, even if you don't feel like it. It will make you feel better, I swear it. Give it a try!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: I'm sorry, Laslow. I know you're right, but I won't be able to smile until Elise is safe. We need to get her medical attention right away, but-

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: What are you saying?! Has something happened to Lady Elise?

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: She's in bad shape, Laslow. She doesn't have much time.

intro.speaker: Peri
intro.line: Hee hee, then let's gut these fools quickly and save our princess! I'm gonna stabby-stab every last one of them! It'll be SO FUN!

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Your enthusiasm has been... noted. But do all you can to avoid taking any lives, OK?

intro.speaker: Laslow
intro.line: If you wish it so, so it shall be. I agree that it's always best to secure a win without needlessly sacrificing lives.

intro.speaker: Peri
intro.line: Awww, that's not FAIR! I was all ready to get my killface on. Phooey. Whatever, I'll do my best. I guess hitting things will have to suffice.

intro.speaker: Corrin
intro.line: Thank you, friends. I'm glad to have you on my side. Ryoma, my brother... I do not wish to fight you, but you've left me no other option. I will not let Elise die, and I can't return to Hoshido either...

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: I am Lord Ryoma's retainer, Saizo. Behold my mastery of explosives!

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: Well done. But next time… will be a different story…

boss.speaker: Kagero
boss.line: If you wish to harm Lord Ryoma, you must get through me first.

boss.speaker: Kagero
boss.line: Forgive me… Lord Ryoma. The enemy’s will… was too strong…

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Return Corrin to me or feel the wrath of my blade!

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Not again! We'll have to...retreat...

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: Fight me, Corrin. It must be destiny that we meet again. Last time we were interrupted… but this time you won’t be so lucky. Let us settle this fair and square.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I wouldn’t want it any other way.

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: Kaze... I never thought I'd live to see my own brother betray us. As your twin, and a proud ninja serving the great kingdom of Hoshido... I want you to know that I am truly ashamed of you and your actions.

boss.speaker: Kaze
boss.line: Saizo, we have been close since the moment we were born. I never wished to disappoint you, but I stand by my decision. Say what you will---I have no regrets. I proudly side with Corrin.

boss.speaker: Saizo
boss.line: You are a fool, Brother. I will show you the error of your ways!

boss.speaker: Kagero
boss.line: As Lord Ryoma’s retainer, it is my duty to follow his every order. He wishes to take you back to Hoshido, and so it must be done.

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I refuse. You may attempt to take me by force, but it won’t end well.

boss.speaker: Kagero
boss.line: You sound most determined. This should be interesting…

boss.speaker: Corrin
boss.line: I'm sorry Ryoma, but you know I can't go back to Hoshido with you. Though it pains me, I will not hesitate to strike you down to save my sister.

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Your sister? Hmph. So you still think of the Nohrian royals as your true family.

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: If you only knew what it would mean to us to have that place in your heart....It's not too late for that. I won't give up on you, Brother/Sister. Never. That's why I must win this battle and take you back to Hoshido! Let us begin!

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Azura... Hinoka and Takumi told me you were fighting with the enemy. I had to see it with my own eyes to believe it. What a pity. I suppose the Nohrian blood flowing in your veins lends itself to betrayal..

boss.speaker: Azura
boss.line: Think of me what you will, Ryoma. But know that I am, and ever shall be, grateful for my time in Hoshido. I'm especially grateful for your family, who raised me as their own. That includes you too, Ryoma. You were like the brother I never had.

boss.speaker: Ryoma
boss.line: Azura... Leave it to you to craft such a lovely farewell. I wish I could forget our time together. It would make this a lot easier. But enough with farewells. Let us battle!

end.speaker: Ryoma
end.line: Our line has been breached... We have no choice. Everyone, retreat! We must escape before Nohrian reinforcements arrive!

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: It looks like the Hoshidan soldiers have finally retreated. Hang in there, Elise. It won't be long now until we can get you that medicine.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Thanks... Corrin... Hee... hee... I'm so glad... You didn't... go back... to Hoshido... *gasp*

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: ELISE!!

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: *pant... pant...*

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: She's running out of time. She needs that medicine now. Stay strong, sweet Elise. We need you to hang in there...

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Zzz... zzz...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: I believe the worst is over. We can rest easy now. As long as she gets plenty of rest, she should make a full recovery.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Thank you, Azura. Your knowledge of herbs and medicine saved her life. This has been a trying ordeal for all of us. I propose we take this opportunity to rest.

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: That's a splendid idea. Perhaps you could start by telling me what's on your mind.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: *sigh* You're very keen, aren't you? I keep wondering how Ryoma knew we'd be here. It's killing me. There's no way the Hoshidan army could have known we were making this detour...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Yes, I've been pondering that as well. We should remain cautious. There might be those among the Nohrians who wish to see you fall...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: But why? What have I done?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: Hmmm... Mmmm... Corrin... Azura...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Elise! You're finally awake. How do you feel?

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: I was having... a dream... Gunter was there... He was talking to me...

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Gunter? Aw, Elise, you know he... That's not possible.

end.speaker: Elise
end.line: No... it was really Gunter... He was worried about you... He looked so lonely... Don't worry... Gunter... Soon we'll... we'll... Zzz... zzz... zzz...

end.speaker: Azura
end.line: Elise? ... She's fallen back asleep.

end.speaker: Corrin
end.line: Hmm, I wonder why she saw Gunter in her dream. Well, I suppose it was just a dream. Gunter died in the Bottomless Canyon. No matter how much we wish we could see him again, it can never be. And yet, I can't help feeling bothered by it. Gunter... Are you trying to tell us something?
